favourite.article: Lord make us into a vessel to contain God exclusively.
ang walay katapusan mong tuyo nga himoon mo ang nadaot nga nangaging katuigan. ang gi alsa ni satanas maoy imong ipahiuli.... gipadayag ning alawiton nga buot nimong humanon ang imong tuyo

Oh Lord Jesus!! You have an eternal purpose. You desire a group of people built together in Your plan. Lord make us these ones. Blended, knit coordinated! Saturate each part of our being. Feeling, mind, and will renewing. Lord, we're wholly for Thy purpose. All Thy goal in us attain! Lord, build Your Church!! Oh Lord Jesus!
Praise the Lord! God will have His corporate vessel Ohh Lord Jesus, Ohh Lord Jesus...

We recently sang this hymn at a dear sister of the Lord passing away. The sister's husband chose this song because she just loved the song so much. It was very encouraging to everyone to sing this hymn.

Hallelujah for God's eternal purpose! Thank You Lord for choosing us for this Divine Revelation! Oh how I praise Him for revealing Himself in this song. Thank you saints of the Most High God to put this hymnal on line.
In Him, By Him and for Him: Rheta Dinucci
It's so nice. I LOVE it!!!!!!

Praise the Lord for His eternal purpose, His economy! He's dispensing Himself in Christ, through the Spirit as Life into us to be a great corporate vessel filled with God alone as its content! When this is expressed on the earth, this will issue in the Kingdom, which eventually, after a 1000 year reign of Christ and His redeemed and transformed people, will consummate in the New Jerusalem! Thank you Lord Jesus for this, God's eternal purpose!

Thank You Lord Jesus, the God, for having an eternal purpose. This is to have a group of people built together in His plan to be blended, knit, coordinated as His vessel, one new man. Oh what a marvelous plan to dispense Himself into us to accomplish His goal, His plan. Thank you Lord Jesus!
I like this song because it teaches us about God's eternal purpose.
This song tells us everything that we need to know about the Lord's recovery.
Because we learn so much about God's eternal purpose, there r very few hymns in the hymn book that correlate.
